headline.main: NEW POLISH ARMY TRAINING IN URALS; One of Its Several Divisions Already Is Fully Equipped, General Anders Says RANKS GROWING RAPIDLY Soviet Officers on Inspection Tour Attend Field Mass of Former War Prisoners

lead_paragraph: MOSCOW, Sept. 30 -- A Polish Army is being formed east of the Ural Mountains by the new Polish High Command, working in collaboration with Soviet authorities. This army, which is expected to consist of several divisions plus reserves, is commanded by General Wladyslaw Anders, who was appointed to the task by Premier Wladyslaw Sikorski on Aug. 4.
abstract: On Polish Army formation in USSR
